metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1000110 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: The CGIHandler class in Python before 2.7.12 does not protect against the HTTP_PROXY variable name clash in a CGI script, which could allow a remote attacker to redirect HTTP requests.

notes.Note: sbeattie> may also need patches from https://bugs.python.org/issue26804

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-3build1').
